body.ab:
My dear Smyly,
I enclose Jouguet's
article, which you can keep
for the winter. Presumably the ^new ???ber
hasnt reached England yet.
The new ???ber of the [??hand] en
(III. II) is devoted to Ptolemaic
pieces, cheifly contracts from Gebelin

but there are some very broken 3rd
cent B.C. documents which look
as if they came from Fayum mummy
cartonnage a doublt date [ocean?], but
the Macedonian month is lost.
Jouguet's papyri by the way make me
more than ever sure that Diophantus
in P.P.II p. 3 was [sl??ty?g?s]
In Euergetes' reign, not Philadelphus'
I also enclose corrected proof of
those clarrial fragments in O.P. III
which are in type. The rest of the book

is unwritten and will be printed
during our absence, and the proofs
will be sent to you in relays. I
dont want them back till April.
We hope to return before the middle
of that month. We leave on the
7th and shall make a short
trip to Wadi Halfa before beginning
excavations at Hibeh early in
January. Address Cairo, as usual.
Various letters have come from foreign
scholars who profess admiration for
Tebtunis. Wilcken letter of it as an
'Egregious fine ????? ??????' and

says he will come to Oxford next
August or September to see the papyrus
I hope you will be here too. De Ricci,
who is now στρατευόμενος for a year,
is publishing revised texts of Revillout's
Ptolemaic papyri in the next Archiv.
Brun will be a great len to you. I am
rather surprised he should care to go. But
I suppose Mrs. B. was keen on England.

Love to J.P.M.
Good-bye
Yours ever
B.P.Grenfell
